chargeHist.descr: Terrorist Threats - Public Panic or Fear

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Terrorist Threats - Public Panic or Fear

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamarria Heavenly Magee

records.addlTxt: Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Shamarria Heavenly Magee.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Shamarria Heavenly Magee.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea hearing date for an entry into a DPA. Court granted defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has not made a decision as to whether the case is appropriate for a DPA.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court of possible DPA resolution and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 25.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Copy of award - filed by defense counsel - received

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.   The court order the matter adjourned HELD OFF THE RECORD for Status Conference.
 Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Resume and copies of letters submitted to the court by defense counsel as to sentencing - received
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (19 pages) commencing April 6, 2022 by Amy De La Rosa.
Documents submitted to the court by defense counsel as to sentencing - received

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Kimberly Kanekeo - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Shamarria Heavenly Magee in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamarria Heavenly Magee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
